frame.name: Law
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Law</fen> regulates activities or states of affairs within a <fen>Jurisdiction</fen>, dictating what <fen>Required</fen> states should be the case and what <fen>Forbidden</fen> states should not. Often it also indicates negative consequences for individuals that violate it, and these negative consequences are generally enforced by some official authority. They may or may not be created by some official legislative body.
<ex>The new <t>act</t> <fex name="Forbidden">banning smoking in public</fex> will pass soon.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Law
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the rule designed to guide activity, deprecating some types of activity and/or requiring other types of activity. This FE is incorporated into each LU in this frame.</def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>The use for which a law is intended.
<ex>We brought back a <t>law</t> <fex name="Use">to forbid the use of profanity</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Law</fen> into existence.
<ex>But this was forbidden by the <fex name="Creator">King's</fex> <t>Law</t> of 1665.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which a <fen>Law</fen> comes into existence.
<ex>The <fex name="Time">1996</fex> welfare reform <t>act</t> was a sham.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>The term used to refer to a <fen>Law</fen>.
<ex>Well, they're still in violation of the <fex name="Name">Sarbanes-Oxley</fex> <t>Act</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>An indication of the subtype of <fen>Law</fen>.
<ex>According to <fex name="Type">Canon</fex> <t>Law</t>, priests may not marry.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Law</fen>.
<ex>We don't need another <t>law</t> <fex name="Part">with 300 subsections</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Forbidden
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state-of-affairs which is disallowed by the <fen>Law</fen>.
<ex>I think we need a <t>law</t> <fex name="for">against all firearms within city limits</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Required
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state-of-affairs which the <fen>Law</fen> declares must be maintained.
<ex>The <t>law</t> <fex name="req">that all minors must be accompanied by an adult</fex> is a laughingstock.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Jurisdiction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where a given <fen>Law</fen> is in force.
<ex>According to <fex name="jur">Fijian</fex> <t>law</t>, no-one may enter the park after sunset.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the <fen>Law</fen> not covered by a more specific frame element.</def-root>
